text:
*— Security Header HubSpot Question ---*
Hey team, I looking for some clarification/sanity check. I was auditing some site security and in particular, `Content-Security-Policy`  Within the `settings>website>domains & urls` under “edit” we can edit the domain security settings “Security headers”. :point_down: It is my understanding that if I enable this setting it defaults to the security policy in the field and when I inspect the given domain I should see a corresponding similar to this :point_down:
```<meta http-equiv="Content-Security-Policy" content=""default-src 'self'" >```
But when I inspect a given site I don’t find said meta. I have checked a few domains we manage. Please let me know if and where I am misunderstanding this. Thanks in advance for anyone who can help. (edited) 
Screen Shot 2022-02-22 at 11.14.00 AM.png
